original: kha tv'am ga rnams bsnams pa'i dkar min spyan gsum ldan la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: kha tv'am ga rnams bsnams pa'i dkar min spyan gsum ldan la phyag 'tshal //
translated: and a khaṭvāṅga. I pay homage to the one with three eyes and an unvirtuous face.

original: g-yas su ram yig rin chen las byung dpal ldan rin chen 'byung ldan //
analyzed: g-yas su ram yig rin chen las byung dpal ldan rin chen 'byung ldan //
translated: To the right, from the raṃ syllable and a jewel, is the glorious Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: dmar po me dang tshor ba'i rang bzhin nyi ma zla ba bung ba'i //
analyzed: dmar po me dang tshor ba'i rang bzhin nyi ma zla ba bung ba'i //
translated: red, the nature of fire and sensation, with faces of the sun, moon, and bee.

original: zhal ldan bdag gi mi yi mnga' bdag @103b mda' dang lcags kyu cang te'u //
analyzed: zhal ldan bdag gi mi yi mnga' bdag @103b mda' dang lcags kyu cang te'u //
translated: He holds a goad, a hook, a small drum,

original: gzhu dang rin chen zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa rnams la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: gzhu dang rin chen zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa rnams la phyag 'tshal //
translated: and a bow and a precious noose in his hands. I pay homage to him.

original: g-yon du au yig padma las byung 'od dpag med ni dkar po //
analyzed: g-yon du au yig padma las byung 'od dpag med ni dkar po //
translated: To the left, from the uṃ syllable and a lotus, is the white Amitābha,

original: chu dang 'du shes rang bzhin bdud rtsi 'od 'phro sprin dang nyi zhal //
analyzed: chu dang 'du shes rang bzhin bdud rtsi 'od 'phro sprin dang nyi zhal //
translated: the nature of water and discernment, radiating nectar, with faces of a cloud and the sun.

original: dpal ldan gos dkar mo yis sbras pa tho ba mdung thung rtse gsum /
analyzed: dpal ldan gos dkar mo yis sbras pa tho ba mdung thung rtse gsum /
translated: He is embraced by the glorious Pāṇḍaravāsinī, and he holds a hammer, a short javelin, and a trident.

original: chu skyes dkar po me long phreng ba rnams 'dzin pa la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: chu skyes dkar po me long phreng ba rnams 'dzin pa la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to those who hold white lotuses, mirrors, and garlands.

original: rgyab tu li yig 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i rnam snang ser po //
analyzed: rgyab tu li yig 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i rnam snang ser po //
translated: Behind, from the wheel of the letter li, arises yellow Vairocana,

original: sa dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin gser dang zla ba nag po'i zhal ldan //
analyzed: sa dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin gser dang zla ba nag po'i zhal ldan //
translated: with faces of earth, form, gold, and black moon.🔽I praise him who holds a wheel marked with a crossed vajra, a club, a vajra,

original: sgrol mas sbras pa'i 'khor lo dang ni dbyug pa rdo rje bsnams dang // dpal gyi dung dang lcags sgrog dril bu phyag na 'dzin pa la bstod //
analyzed: sgrol mas sbras pa'i 'khor lo dang ni dbyug pa rdo rje bsnams dang // dpal gyi dung dang lcags sgrog dril bu phyag na 'dzin pa la bstod //
translated: a glorious conch, and an iron chain and bell in his hands.

original: sangs rgyas rnams mtshungs btsun mo rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams mtshungs btsun mo rnams //
translated: The consorts of the buddhas are equal to them.

original: padma dmar dang zla ba la //
analyzed: padma dmar dang zla ba la //
translated: On red lotuses and moon seats,

original: thams cad padma'i 'dug stangs bzhugs //
analyzed: thams cad padma'i 'dug stangs bzhugs //
translated: all are seated in the lotus posture.

original: kun la rin chen cod pan bsam //🔽l'i yig 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i spyan ma sa khams rang bzhin //
analyzed: kun la rin chen cod pan bsam // l'i yig 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i spyan ma sa khams rang bzhin //
translated: Imagine jeweled crowns on all.🔽From the wheel of the letter la arises Locanā, the nature of the earth element,🔽equal to Vairocana, with Amoghasiddhi and the wind direction.

original: rnam par snang mdzad mtshungs dang don grub dang bcas rlung mtshams gnas dang // a'u yig padma las byung bdag gi ma ste chu khams rang bzhin //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mtshungs dang don grub dang bcas rlung mtshams gnas dang // a'u yig padma las byung bdag gi ma ste chu khams rang bzhin //
translated: From the letter āṃ arises Māmakī, the nature of the water element,

original: 'od dpag med mtshungs rin 'byung dang bcas dbang ldan gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: 'od dpag med mtshungs rin 'byung dang bcas dbang ldan gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to Ratnasambhava, who is like Amitābha, in the northeast.

original: r'i yig dang ni rin chen dag las byung ba'i gos dkar mo ste //
analyzed: r'i yig dang ni rin chen dag las byung ba'i gos dkar mo ste //
translated: The letter Ra and a jewel produce Pāṇḍaravāsinī,🔽who is of the nature of the fire element, like Ratnasambhava, in the southwest.

original: me khams rang bzhin rin 'byung dang mtshungs bden bral la gnas pa dang // a'i yig ral gri las byung ba yi sgrol ma rlung khams rang bzhin //
analyzed: me khams rang bzhin rin 'byung dang mtshungs bden bral la gnas pa dang // a'i yig ral gri las byung ba yi sgrol ma rlung khams rang bzhin //
translated: The letter A and a sword produce Tārā, who is of the nature of the wind element,

original: don grub dang mtshungs rnam snang dang bcas me mtshams gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: don grub dang mtshungs rnam snang dang bcas me mtshams gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to Amoghasiddhi, who is like Vairocana, in the southeast.

original: ham yig las byung rgyal ba'i bum pa mtshan nyid dang ldan dpal ldan thugs kyi 'khor lo yi //
analyzed: ham yig las byung rgyal ba'i bum pa mtshan nyid dang ldan dpal ldan thugs kyi 'khor lo yi //
translated: The letter Haṃ arises from the letter Haṃ, the glorious mind wheel, the characteristics of the Victor’s vase,

original: shar gyi sgo ru khro bo'i gdan gyi phyi ru padma nyid la dgod par bya ba ste //
analyzed: shar gyi sgo ru khro bo'i gdan gyi phyi ru padma nyid la dgod par bya ba ste //
translated: which should be placed on a lotus outside the wrathful seat in the east.

original: de ltar hi yig las byung gti mug rdo rje'i g-yas su dgod de de bzhin rin chen sogs //
analyzed: de ltar hi yig las byung gti mug rdo rje'i g-yas su dgod de de bzhin rin chen sogs //
translated: In the same way, the letter Hi arises from the letter Hi, and is placed to the right of Mohavajra.

original: g-yas dgod hri hu hli las byung bum pa de rnam la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: g-yas dgod hri hu hli las byung bum pa de rnam la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to those who are placed to the right, the vase that arises from the letters Hri, Hu, and Hi.

original: h'li h'um hr'i h'i las byung bum pa spyan sogs g-yas su rim bzhin dgod //
analyzed: h'li h'um hr'i h'i las byung bum pa spyan sogs g-yas su rim bzhin dgod //
translated: The vase born from the syllable hūṃ hriḥ hai, the eyes, etc., are placed in order to the right.

original: ha yig las byung rnam rgyal bum pa sgo gzhan gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: ha yig las byung rnam rgyal bum pa sgo gzhan gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The vase of victory born from the syllable ha is placed at the other door.

original: sangs rgyas ji bzhin rgyal sras rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji bzhin rgyal sras rnams //
translated: The Bodhisattvas are like the Buddhas,

original: 'on kyang rin chen cod pan ldan //
analyzed: 'on kyang rin chen cod pan ldan //
translated: but have the jewel crown.

original: lha mo de bzhin lha mo rnams //
analyzed: lha mo de bzhin lha mo rnams //
translated: The goddesses are like the goddesses,

original: de ltar rin bzhin rab tu gnas //
analyzed: de ltar rin bzhin rab tu gnas //
translated: but are seated on jewels.

original: aa yig rdo rje dag las byung ba'i dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje thugs kar rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: aa yig rdo rje dag las byung ba'i dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje thugs kar rdo rje nyid //
translated: Glorious Vajrapāṇi born from the syllable a and the vajra, holding a vajra at the heart,

original: sngon po @104a * //
analyzed: sngon po @104a * //
translated: is blue.

original: bzung ba rna ba'i dbang po'i bdag nyid mnga' bdag mi bskyod pa dang mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: bzung ba rna ba'i dbang po'i bdag nyid mnga' bdag mi bskyod pa dang mtshungs pa ste //
translated: He is like Lord Akṣobhya, the nature of the ear organ.

original: ljang gu lho sgo'i g-yon gyi rtsig pa'i drung du de yi gdan dang mtshungs par bzhugs pa la //
analyzed: ljang gu lho sgo'i g-yon gyi rtsig pa'i drung du de yi gdan dang mtshungs par bzhugs pa la //
translated: Green, he stands at the left of the wall of the southern door, on a seat like his.

original: spyi bo sa la reg ste de yi zhabs la shin tu dga' bas rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: spyi bo sa la reg ste de yi zhabs la shin tu dga' bas rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Touching his head to the ground, he pays homage with great joy at his feet.

original: ai yig ral gri dag las byung ba'i nam mkha'i snying po don grub dang mtshungs sna nyid kyi //
analyzed: ai yig ral gri dag las byung ba'i nam mkha'i snying po don grub dang mtshungs sna nyid kyi //
translated: Akashagarbha, born from the sword of the letter I, is like Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal gyi rdo rje ma bcas shar sgo'i g-yas na bzhugs pa la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal gyi rdo rje ma bcas shar sgo'i g-yas na bzhugs pa la phyag 'tshal //
translated: He is the nature of the nose sense power, and is in the right corner of the eastern gate, together with Shrivajra.

original: aar yig rin chen las byung sa yi snying po rin chen 'byung ldan dang mtshungs sku mdog dmar po nyid //🔽mig gi dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal ldan gzugs kyi rdo rje mar bcas lho sgo'i g-yas gnas dang // aom yig pad byung 'jig rten dbang phyug 'od dpag med mtshungs rdo rje rjes //🔽bcas dang lce dbang rang bzhin byang sgo'i g-yas su gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: aar yig rin chen las byung sa yi snying po rin chen 'byung ldan dang mtshungs sku mdog dmar po nyid // mig gi dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal ldan gzugs kyi rdo rje mar bcas lho sgo'i g-yas gnas dang // aom yig pad byung 'jig rten dbang phyug 'od dpag med mtshungs rdo rje rjes // bcas dang lce dbang rang bzhin byang sgo'i g-yas su gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Kshitigarbha, born from the jewel of the letter A, is like Ratnasambhava, and is red in color.🔽He is the nature of the eye sense power, and is in the right corner of the southern gate, together with Shrivajra.🔽Avalokiteshvara, born from the lotus of the letter Om, is like Amitabha, and is the nature of the tongue sense power, and is in the right corner of the western gate, together with Vajrarupa.

original: aal yig 'khor lo las byung sgrib pa rnam sel mdzes pa'i gser dang mtshungs pa yi //
analyzed: aal yig 'khor lo las byung sgrib pa rnam sel mdzes pa'i gser dang mtshungs pa yi //
translated: Samantabhadra, born from the wheel of the letter A, is like Vairochana, and is the nature of the body sense power, and is in the right corner of the northern gate, together with Shrivajra.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal ldan rgyal ba rnam par snang mdzad dang mtshungs pa //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i rang bzhin dpal ldan rgyal ba rnam par snang mdzad dang mtshungs pa //
translated: whose nature is the organ of touch, and who is equal to the glorious Victor Vairochana.

original: gang gi pang na reg bya rdo rje ma dang bcas nub sgo'i g-yas phyogs na //
analyzed: gang gi pang na reg bya rdo rje ma dang bcas nub sgo'i g-yas phyogs na //
translated: In whose lap is the goddess of touch, together with the goddess of touch, to the right of the western door,

original: rgyun du yang dag gnas pa de la rtag tu gus pas rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyun du yang dag gnas pa de la rtag tu gus pas rab tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: who always abides perfectly, to her I always pay homage with respect.

original: aam yig rdo rje dag las byung ba'i kun du bzang //
analyzed: aam yig rdo rje dag las byung ba'i kun du bzang //
translated: The letter A and the vajra give rise to Samantabhadra,

original: sku la chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma yis 'khyud //
analyzed: sku la chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma yis 'khyud //
translated: embraced by the goddess of the realm of phenomena,

original: yid kyi rang bzhin dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpar mtshungs //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpar mtshungs //
translated: whose nature is the mind, equal to the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: shar sgo'i g-yon du gnas pa la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: shar sgo'i g-yon du gnas pa la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to her, who abides to the left of the eastern door.

original: aa yig dang ni rdo rje dag las byung ba'i rdo rje ma ste sgar yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan phyag rdor dang mtshungs shes rab pha rol phyin ma dang mtshungs byang sgo'i g-yon du gnas //
analyzed: aa yig dang ni rdo rje dag las byung ba'i rdo rje ma ste sgar yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan phyag rdor dang mtshungs shes rab pha rol phyin ma dang mtshungs byang sgo'i g-yon du gnas //
translated: The letter A and the vajra give rise to Vajra, whose nature is the body, equal to the glorious Vajrapani, and equal to Prajnaparamita, who abides to the left of the northern door.

original: a'a la yig dang ni 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i dri yi rdo rje ma ste dri yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan spyan ma dang mtshungs nam mkha'i snying po dang bcas rlung mtshams bzhugs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: a'a la yig dang ni 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i dri yi rdo rje ma ste dri yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan spyan ma dang mtshungs nam mkha'i snying po dang bcas rlung mtshams bzhugs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and is equal to glorious Locanā, together with Akāśagarbha, in the southwest.🔽Rūpavajrā, born from the syllable oṃ and the lotus, is of the nature of form,

original: aoo yig chu skyes dag las byung ba'i gzugs kyi rdo rje ma ste gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan bdag gi ma mtshungs sa yi snying po dang bcas dbang ldan la gnas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: aoo yig chu skyes dag las byung ba'i gzugs kyi rdo rje ma ste gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan bdag gi ma mtshungs sa yi snying po dang bcas dbang ldan la gnas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and is equal to glorious Māmakī, together with Kṣitigarbha, in the northeast.🔽Rasavajrā, born from the syllable ā and the jewel, is of the nature of taste,

original: a'ar yig dang ni rin chen las byung ba yi ro yi rdo rje ma ste ro yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan gos dkar mo mtshungs 'jig rten dbang po dang bcas bden bral la gnas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: a'ar yig dang ni rin chen las byung ba yi ro yi rdo rje ma ste ro yi rang bzhin dang // dpal ldan gos dkar mo mtshungs 'jig rten dbang po dang bcas bden bral la gnas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and is equal to glorious Pāṇḍaravāsinī, together with Lokiteśvara, in the southwest.

original: aee yig dang ni ral @104b gri dag las byung ba'i reg bya rdo rje ma ste reg bya'i rang bzhin dang // sgrol ma dang mtshungs sgrib pa rnam sel dang bcas me mtshams gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: aee yig dang ni ral @104b gri dag las byung ba'i reg bya rdo rje ma ste reg bya'i rang bzhin dang // sgrol ma dang mtshungs sgrib pa rnam sel dang bcas me mtshams gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to Tārā, who is similar to Mañjuśrī, and resides in the southeast.

original: a'a yig rdo rje las byung chos dbyings rdo rje ma ste rdo rje dbyings ma dang mtshungs ma //
analyzed: a'a yig rdo rje las byung chos dbyings rdo rje ma ste rdo rje dbyings ma dang mtshungs ma //
translated: Dharmadhātuvajrā, born from the letter A and the vajra, is similar to Vajradhātvīśvarī.

original: kun du bzang po dang ni bcas pa nub sgo'i g-yon la gnas pa la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: kun du bzang po dang ni bcas pa nub sgo'i g-yon la gnas pa la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to Samantabhadra, who resides in the west, on the left of the southern gate.

original: khro rnams ral gcig dmar la ser //
analyzed: khro rnams ral gcig dmar la ser //
translated: The wrathful ones have one braid, are red and yellow,

original: ngag lag rkang bshad rang bzhin te //
analyzed: ngag lag rkang bshad rang bzhin te //
translated: and have the nature of speech, hands, and feet.

original: sangs rgyas sras rnams dang mtshungs ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras rnams dang mtshungs ba //
translated: They are similar to the sons of the Buddha,

original: g-yas brkyang zhabs dang sprul gyis brgyan //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang zhabs dang sprul gyis brgyan //
translated: with right legs extended, and adorned with snakes.

original: yam yig dang ni ral gri dag las byung ba'i bgegs kyi dgra nyid nam mkha'i snying po mtshungs //
analyzed: yam yig dang ni ral gri dag las byung ba'i bgegs kyi dgra nyid nam mkha'i snying po mtshungs //
translated: Vighnāntaka, born from the letter Ya and the sword, is similar to Ākāśagarbha.

original: rengs byed ma ni m'a r'i tsi mtshungs spangs gnas shar sgo'i dbus su chu skyes dkar po dang // nyi ma la gnas pa dang ram yig dbyug pa las byung shes rab mthar byed sa snying dang // mtshungs dang nga rgyal ma mtshungs tsunda dang bcas lho phyogs la gnas dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rengs byed ma ni m'a r'i tsi mtshungs spangs gnas shar sgo'i dbus su chu skyes dkar po dang // nyi ma la gnas pa dang ram yig dbyug pa las byung shes rab mthar byed sa snying dang // mtshungs dang nga rgyal ma mtshungs tsunda dang bcas lho phyogs la gnas dag la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Prajñāntakṛt, like Kṣitigarbha, and Mānamatī, like Cundā, are in the south, arisen from a lotus and sun.

original: byang sgor padma zla ba la gnas wam yig chu skyes dag las byung ba'i padma'i dgra //
analyzed: byang sgor padma zla ba la gnas wam yig chu skyes dag las byung ba'i padma'i dgra //
translated: At the northern gate, on a lotus and moon, is Padmāntaka, arisen from the syllable vaṃ.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug dang mtshungs rmongs byed ma ni khro gnyer can ma dang ni mtshungs pa dang // lam yig tho ba las byung gshin rje'i dgra nyid sgrib pa sel mtshungs shin tu brtson 'grus ma //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug dang mtshungs rmongs byed ma ni khro gnyer can ma dang ni mtshungs pa dang // lam yig tho ba las byung gshin rje'i dgra nyid sgrib pa sel mtshungs shin tu brtson 'grus ma //
translated: Moha-jñānā, like Lokeśvara, and Bhṛkuṭī, like Khagarbha, are in the west, arisen from the syllable laṃ.🔽Yama-jñāna, like Nivāraṇaviṣkambhin, and Vīryavatī, like Vajrapāṇi, are in the north, arisen from the syllable paṃ.

original: rdo rje lcags sgrog dang ni mtshungs pa pam gnas nub phyogs la gnas zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags sgrog dang ni mtshungs pa pam gnas nub phyogs la gnas zhabs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage at the feet of those who are in the cardinal directions.

original: rdo rje dung dang gzer bu dang // dpal 'bras cod pan bza' dang // de ltar phyag mtshan rnams las byung //
analyzed: rdo rje dung dang gzer bu dang // dpal 'bras cod pan bza' dang // de ltar phyag mtshan rnams las byung //
translated: The vajra, the conch, the nail, the glorious fruit, the diadem, and the food—

original: so so'i ming gis mchod byed pa //
analyzed: so so'i ming gis mchod byed pa //
translated: these are the hand implements that arise from the individual names.

original: ka tsa ta pa ta sa sde tshan thung du thogs las byung ba ni //
analyzed: ka tsa ta pa ta sa sde tshan thung du thogs las byung ba ni //
translated: The short vowels of the ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and pa groups arise as🔽the goddesses of the right side, such as the goddess of gods, the goddess of death, and so on, as well as the sense objects of smell, and so on, above and below.

original: lha dang gshin rje la sogs g-yas kyi 'dod yon rnams dang steng dang 'og /'dir ni rim pa bzhin du glu ma dri ma spos ma gsol zas ma //🔽lho mo sgeg mo gar ma ma lus phyag gnyis zla ba'i zhal dang ldan //
analyzed: lha dang gshin rje la sogs g-yas kyi 'dod yon rnams dang steng dang 'og /'dir ni rim pa bzhin du glu ma dri ma spos ma gsol zas ma // lho mo sgeg mo gar ma ma lus phyag gnyis zla ba'i zhal dang ldan //
translated: Here, in order, they are the goddesses of song, smell, incense, and food.

original: pa ta ha dang snod mar me //
analyzed: pa ta ha dang snod mar me //
translated: The long vowels of the ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and pa groups arise as🔽the goddesses of the left side, such as the goddess of humans, the goddess of antigods, and so on, as well as the sense objects of sound, and so on, above and below.🔽Here, in order, they are the goddesses of dance, touch, taste, and sight.

original: mu tig phreng dang phreng chu skyes //
analyzed: mu tig phreng dang phreng chu skyes //
translated: The long vowels of the sa, sa, ṣa, sa, and ha groups arise as🔽the goddesses of the front side, such as the goddess of the nāgas, the goddess of the yakṣas, and so on, as well as the sense objects of smell, and so on, above and below.🔽Here, in order, they are the goddesses of the lute, the flower, the music, and the incense.

original: rim bzhin phyag mtshan las byung ba //
analyzed: rim bzhin phyag mtshan las byung ba //
translated: The long vowels of the ka, ca, ṭa, ta, and pa groups arise as🔽the goddesses of the back side, such as the goddess of the bhūtas, the goddess of the rākṣasas, and so on, as well as the sense objects of sound, and so on, above and below.🔽Here, in order, they are the goddesses of the lamp, the garland, the dance, and the perfume.

original: lha mo thams cad sa bon mdog / s'a t'a p'a t'a ts'a k'a'i sde tshan ring po brtsegs pa gyur las byung ba yi //
analyzed: lha mo thams cad sa bon mdog / s'a t'a p'a t'a ts'a k'a'i sde tshan ring po brtsegs pa gyur las byung ba yi //
translated: The long vowels of the sa, sa, ṣa, sa, and ha groups arise as

original: chu sogs g-yon gyi 'dod pa yon rnams dang steng dang 'og rnams la //
analyzed: chu sogs g-yon gyi 'dod pa yon rnams dang steng dang 'og rnams la //

original: zhes pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo la phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs kyi 'khor lo la phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the order of the verses of homage to the mind wheel.🔽The goddesses Cārumatī and so on, with one face and three eyes,

original: @105a * // lha mo tsa rtsi k'a sogs sa ga'i rkang stabs dang // zhal gcig spyan gsum rig byed lag dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: @105a * // lha mo tsa rtsi k'a sogs sa ga'i rkang stabs dang // zhal gcig spyan gsum rig byed lag dang ldan pa yi //

original: lte ba'i padma la gnas gshin rje'i rtsa rnams kyi //
analyzed: lte ba'i padma la gnas gshin rje'i rtsa rnams kyi //
translated: They are on the navel cakra, in the channels of Yama.

analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rin chen dang ldan chod pan can //
translated: They are endowed with the pure jewels and have topknots.

original: shar du ha yig gri gug las byung tsa rtsi k'a //
analyzed: shar du ha yig gri gug las byung tsa rtsi k'a //
translated: In the east, from the syllable ha and a flaying knife arises Cārumati.

original: gri gug rtse gsum thod pa kha tv'am ga nyid bsnams //
analyzed: gri gug rtse gsum thod pa kha tv'am ga nyid bsnams //
translated: She holds a flaying knife, a trident, a skull cup, and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: phyag na 'dzin pa'i dbang po dang bcas gang yin pa //🔽ro dang padma dmar gnas la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag na 'dzin pa'i dbang po dang bcas gang yin pa // ro dang padma dmar gnas la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: She is together with Indra, who holds a thunderbolt.🔽I pay homage to her, who is on a corpse and red lotus.

original: tsa rtsi k'a sogs padma bsnams //
analyzed: tsa rtsi k'a sogs padma bsnams //
translated: Cārumati and so on hold lotuses.

original: rim pas chu tshod rtsa rang bzhin //🔽mdun nas g-yas skor rim pa bzhin //
analyzed: rim pas chu tshod rtsa rang bzhin // mdun nas g-yas skor rim pa bzhin //
translated: The nāḍīs are in the four directions,🔽in the four intermediate directions, and in the zenith and the nadir.

original: padma rnams la rol pas bzhugs //
analyzed: padma rnams la rol pas bzhugs //
translated: They are in the lotus petals, in the order of the directions,🔽in the manner of the play of the eight goddesses.

analyzed: 'jigs byed drag po mche ba gnyis gtsigs ma dang kha nas me 'bar ma dang rlung shugs rab gtum ma //

analyzed: gtum mig ma dang sna chen ma rnams klu yi pad 'dab rnams la rtsa rtsi k'a la phyogs nas gnas pa'o //

analyzed: brgyad rnams dpal gyi gtso mo dang mtshungs hri ya yir sbre hi yig rnams dang gri gug las byung bsgom //

analyzed: yu ylim yam rnams dang ni gri gug las byung dpal gyi rnal 'byor rnams la 'dir ni phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: ha: yig dbyug pa dag las byung ba'i phag mo dmar mo dang ni bde byed dkar po dang bcas nyi ma yi //

analyzed: padma ma he'i steng gnas phyag na dbyug pa ral gri lcags sgrog phub chung rnams dang ldan pa //

analyzed: gshin rje la ni bzhugs pa'i zhabs gnyis dag la nges par phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: keng rus dus mtshan ma dang khro gdong dus kyi lce dang gtsigs ma //

analyzed: nag mo 'jigs ma gzugs ngan klu yi 'dab ma la gnas lha rnams //
translated: to Kṛṣṇā, to Bhayānakā, to Durvarṇā, to the nāga-winged goddesses,🔽to Śrīdevī, to Hriri, to Hriru, to Rili, to Ramā,

original: dpal gyi lha mo dang mtshungs hri ra ri rri hr'i ru rli ram rnams dang // dbyug pa las byung dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: dpal gyi lha mo dang mtshungs hri ra ri rri hr'i ru rli ram rnams dang // dbyug pa las byung dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma la phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: tam yig rtse gsum dag las byung ba'i drag mo nyid kyi phyag na rtse gsum cang te'u kha tv'am ga dang ltos 'gor dkar po //
translated: I bow to the fierce one arisen from the syllable tam, the trident, and the skull-cup, holding a trident, a small drum, a khaṭvāṅga, and a white elephant,

analyzed: rin pa ji lta ba rnams gshin rje dang bcas byang chub du khyu mchog dang ni padma dmar po la gnas pa la phyag 'tshal //
translated: to the one with a human skin, together with Yama, the supreme bull, and the red lotus.

translated: Gauri, Ghasmari, Chatra, Chatradharani, Pukkasi, Savari, Chandika, and Vetali, these eight, are on the fierce Naga lotus.

analyzed: dpal gyi drag mo dang ni mtshungs ma tu wa wi wri hum nyid rnams dang wu wli wa rnams //

analyzed: rtse gsum dag las byung ba de rnams kun la rab tu dad pa'i sgo nas nges par phyag 'tshal @105b lo ;
translated: all of them, born from the three points, I pay homage to them with devotion.

analyzed: / h'a yig rdo rje las byung dbang mo gser gyi kha dog dang mtshungs //

analyzed: rdo rje mda' dang dril bu gzhu ni lag pa'i padmas 'dzin ma //

analyzed: lha min dang bcas chu bdag phyogs su glang po dkar po dang ni //

analyzed: padma dmar po'i steng na gnas pa la ni rab tu phyag 'tshal //

analyzed: rdo rje 'od ma rdo rje lus ma gser mchog ldan ma rigs 'dzin ma sna tshogs ri mo ma //
translated: Vajraprabha, Vajradeha, Suvarṇadharā, Kuladhara, Citracitra,

analyzed: chu shing ma dang zung rdu sel la ma shin tu sgrol ma rnams ni lag 'dzin pad 'dab la //
translated: Kadambala, and Utpala, and also Tārā, are in the petals of the lotus in the hands.

analyzed: gnas pa brgyad rnams dpal gyi gtso mo dang mtshungs hli la li lli lam rnams dang ni //

analyzed: rdo rje dag las rab tu byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kun la dir ni nges par phyag 'tshal lo ;
translated: I pay homage to all the yoginīs who have emerged from the vajra.

analyzed: rim pa bzhin du kshl'i l'a l'i lr'i kshl'i l'u lli la: rnams dang dung dag las ni byung ba yi //

analyzed: tshangs ma dang ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kun la rab tu dang bas yang dag phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: With complete faith, I pay homage to all the Brahmani and Yogini goddesses.

analyzed: kshu dang padma las byung bkra shis ma ni zla ba dang mtshungs pad phreng ka ma la dang rin chen nor bu phyag ldan ma //

analyzed: dpal ldan dkar mo zla ba'i ri mo can ma ri bong 'dzin zhal dang pa'i mdog ma 'dzin byed ma //
translated: The glorious white one with the moon's mark, the color of the moon's face, is the one who holds the moon.

analyzed: padma'i dbang phyung ma dang 'od zer can ma dri med zla 'dzi ma rnams dbang ldan mtshams nyid du //
translated: The one who has the lotus's power, the one with light rays, the one who holds the stainless moon, are in the northeast.

analyzed: bkra shis ma yi pad 'dab rnams la rim bzhin kshu w'a w'i wr'i ksh'u w'u wl'i wa: rnams dang ni //

analyzed: padma dag las yang dag byung ba'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kun la thams cad phyag 'tshal lo //

analyzed: kshr'i yig shakti las byung gzhon nu ma nyid nyi ma dang mtshungs //

analyzed: bden bral mtshams nas rma bya padma dkar po'i steng na gnas pa'i //

analyzed: tshogs kyi bdag po dang ni bcas pa gang yin de la phyag 'tshal //
translated: is Gaṇeśa, to whom I pay homage.

original: padma dus su ma dang yan @106a * //
analyzed: padma dus su ma dang yan @106a * //
translated: The one who arises from the letter ṆA and a lotus,

original: lag med ma gzhon nu ma dang seng ge 'gros ma rin chen phreng ba ma //
analyzed: lag med ma gzhon nu ma dang seng ge 'gros ma rin chen phreng ba ma //
translated: The young maiden Alambusha, the lion-paced Ratnamala,

analyzed: mig mdzes ma dang kun ma bzang mo rnams ni gtso mo chu skyes gtsug phud can gyis 'gros ma yi //

analyzed: padma'i 'dab ma la gnas rim pa bzhin du kshr'i r'a r'i rr'i kshr'i r'u rl'i ra: rnams dang ni //
translated: are on lotus petals, in order, with Ksha, Ra, Ra, Ri, Ri, Ru, Ri, Lu, Ri, and La,

analyzed: shakti dag las byung ba'i lha mo de rnams dang ni bcas ba rnams la rgyun du phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and with Shakti, and with those goddesses, I always bow down.

analyzed: ksh'i yig 'khor lo dag las byung ba'i dpal ldan khyab 'jug ma nyid //

analyzed: zhal bzhi dang bcas pa yis gnag pa'i sku mnga' 'khor lo dbyug pa //

analyzed: chu skyes dang ni dag pa'i dung rnams 'dzin pa'i phyag ldan me mtshams //

analyzed: padma dkar po dang ni bya khyung la gnas de la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I bow to her, dwelling on a white lotus and Garuda.

analyzed: sa bon rnams dang so so'i phyag mtshan rnams las byung ba'i 'dod ma lnga rnams phyag gnyis ri bong zhal //

analyzed: shar sgo la sogs rnams kyi g-yas kyi 'dod yon rnams la sa bon rang bzhin tsa ta pa ta yi //

analyzed: sa sde las byung ha sde las //

analyzed: byung ba byang g-yon de las gzhan //

analyzed: kshi yig las byung rnams la 'dud //

analyzed: ces pa rnams gsung gi 'khor lo'i tshigs su bcad pa'o //

analyzed: tsa rtsi k'a sogs dang mtshungs 'jig rten skyong ba rnams kyi rigs rnams //

original: lho sgo'i g-yon gyi 'dod yon la ni nges par gsal byed ka kha ga gha nga rnams thig le dang // bcas pa'i sa bon las byung mi 'dod ma rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste mda' yi grangs rnams so //
analyzed: lho sgo'i g-yon gyi 'dod yon la ni nges par gsal byed ka kha ga gha nga rnams thig le dang // bcas pa'i sa bon las byung mi 'dod ma rnams zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste mda' yi grangs rnams so //
translated: At the sense objects to the left of the southern door, the clear syllables KA, KHĀ, GA, GHĀ, ṄA, together with the seed syllables and bindus, are the ones born from the desireless, with one face and two arms, the number of arrows.

original: shar la sogs pa'i g-yas kyi 'dod yon rnams la tsa ta pa ta'i sde tshan rnams las rab tu byung //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i g-yas kyi 'dod yon rnams la tsa ta pa ta'i sde tshan rnams las rab tu byung //
translated: The objects of desire to the right of the east, etc., are the C, T, T, P, and T groups.

original: de ltar de rnams so so'i phyogs la lnga yi grangs kyi sa bon dang bcas so so'i phyag mtshan no //
analyzed: de ltar de rnams so so'i phyogs la lnga yi grangs kyi sa bon dang bcas so so'i phyag mtshan no //
translated: Thus, each of them in their respective directions has the number five, the seed, and the respective hand implement.

original: de ltar sa sde'i shar gyi g-yon //
analyzed: de ltar sa sde'i shar gyi g-yon //
translated: Thus, in the east of the earth group,

original: 'dod yon la ste ha ste byang //
analyzed: 'dod yon la ste ha ste byang //
translated: the object of desire is Hā, in the north,

original: de las gzhan pa ksha yig las //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ksha yig las //
translated: and from the other one, the letter KṢA,

original: byung ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byung ba rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: the ones arisen from that are to be saluted.

original: 'khor lo la gnas lha nyid de rnams ma lus pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo la gnas lha nyid de rnams ma lus pa //
translated: All of those deities abiding in the wheel,

original: zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste spyan gsum dang ldan ma //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma ste spyan gsum dang ldan ma //
translated: with one face, two arms, and three eyes,

original: phyag rgyas spras shing skra grol na bza' rnams dang bral //
analyzed: phyag rgyas spras shing skra grol na bza' rnams dang bral //
translated: adorned with the seals, with loose hair, and without clothing,🔽with the head garland of glory, with the hand implements of flaying knife and skull cup,

original: dpal gyi mgo bo'i phreng ba'i gri gug thod pa'i phyag / h'a yig gri gug las byung rdo rje spyan ma nyid //
analyzed: dpal gyi mgo bo'i phreng ba'i gri gug thod pa'i phyag / h'a yig gri gug las byung rdo rje spyan ma nyid //
translated: and Vajranairātmyā herself arisen from the syllable HĀ and the flaying knife.

original: ljang gu rgyan dang bcas pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung gi / rnam par dag pa'i sku mnga' steng gi phyogs nyid du //
analyzed: ljang gu rgyan dang bcas pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung gi / rnam par dag pa'i sku mnga' steng gi phyogs nyid du //
translated: green, adorned, with the little finger of the left [hand],

original: rkang brgyad 'khor lo ljang gu la ni gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rkang brgyad 'khor lo ljang gu la ni gnas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is in the upper direction, standing on the eight-footed green wheel,

original: gang gi me dang rlung dkyil 'khor lo dag gi dbus kyi cha //
analyzed: gang gi me dang rlung dkyil 'khor lo dag gi dbus kyi cha //
translated: the one who is in the middle of the fire and wind maṇḍalas,

original: ka sde brtsegs pa dang ni gri gug las byung khyi gdong ma //
analyzed: ka sde brtsegs pa dang ni gri gug las byung khyi gdong ma //
translated: the one arisen from the stacked ka group and flaying knife, with a dog face,

original: nag mo 'jog po dang ni bcas pa lha yi dbang po'i phyogs su //
analyzed: nag mo 'jog po dang ni bcas pa lha yi dbang po'i phyogs su //
translated: black, with Vāsuki, in the direction of the lord of gods,

original: ral gri can dang 'khor lo dmar po la ni gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: ral gri can dang 'khor lo dmar po la ni gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is in the red sword and wheel,🔽in the same way, in the Kṣa, Ya, Ra, Wa, and La [directions],

original: de bzhin ksha ya r'a wa la dang // gri gug las byung phag gdong dmar mo //
analyzed: de bzhin ksha ya r'a wa la dang // gri gug las byung phag gdong dmar mo //
translated: the one arisen from the flaying knife, with a red pig face,

original: dga' bo dang bcas lho yi phyogs su //
analyzed: dga' bo dang bcas lho yi phyogs su //
translated: with Ananta, in the southern direction,

original: dom dang 'khor lo gnas la phyag 'tshal //🔽de bzhin ha ya ra wa la dang // gri gug las byung stag gdong dkar mo //
analyzed: dom dang 'khor lo gnas la phyag 'tshal // de bzhin ha ya ra wa la dang // gri gug las byung stag gdong dkar mo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who is in the bear and wheel,🔽in the same way, in the Ha, Ya, Ra, Wa, and La [directions],

original: chu bdag dang bcas byang gi phyogs su //
analyzed: chu bdag dang bcas byang gi phyogs su //
translated: the one arisen from the flaying knife, with a white tiger face,🔽with Varuṇa, in the northern direction,

original: g-yag dang 'khor lor gnas la phyag 'tshal //🔽de bzhin thka sha sha wa sa dang // gri gug las byung ce spyang gdong ma //
analyzed: g-yag dang 'khor lor gnas la phyag 'tshal // de bzhin thka sha sha wa sa dang // gri gug las byung ce spyang gdong ma //
translated: I pay homage to the one who stands on a buffalo and a wheel.🔽Similarly, in the west, there is the yellow one with a face like a jackal,

original: ser mo karko ta bcas nub tu //
analyzed: ser mo karko ta bcas nub tu //
translated: born from a curved knife, together with a tortoise.

original: seng ge 'khor lor gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: seng ge 'khor lor gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to the one who stands on a lion and a wheel.🔽The yellow, white, red, and black ones with faces like a jackal, owl, vulture, and crow, born from curved knives,🔽together with Padma, Śaṅkhapāla, Ananta, and Mahāpadma,

original: tu pu tu tsu rnams dang gri gug las byung bya yi dbang po 'ug pa @109b bya rgod khva rnams dang // mtshungs pa'i gdong can ser mo dkar mo dmar mo nag mo rnams ni padma dung skyong dga' bo dang // padma chen po dang bcas rlung dang 'phrog byed ster byed me mtshams rnams su shing rta'i tshogs bcom nas //
analyzed: tu pu tu tsu rnams dang gri gug las byung bya yi dbang po 'ug pa @109b bya rgod khva rnams dang // mtshungs pa'i gdong can ser mo dkar mo dmar mo nag mo rnams ni padma dung skyong dga' bo dang // padma chen po dang bcas rlung dang 'phrog byed ster byed me mtshams rnams su shing rta'i tshogs bcom nas //
translated: having conquered the hosts of demons in the directions of wind, Rāhu, Agni, and Indra,

original: longs spyod pa yi bzhon pa mig sngon bya long bhe dunda dang 'khor lo dkar po gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: longs spyod pa yi bzhon pa mig sngon bya long bhe dunda dang 'khor lo dkar po gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: ride on the vehicles of enjoyment, namely, a blue bird, a blind buffalo, a bheḍuṇḍa, and a white wheel.

original: ha: yig gri gug las byung sngon mo kha dog sngo //
analyzed: ha: yig gri gug las byung sngon mo kha dog sngo //
translated: The blue one born from the syllable hūṃ and a curved knife,

original: rgyal ba dang bcas 'og tu rlung dang 'khor lo nyid //
analyzed: rgyal ba dang bcas 'og tu rlung dang 'khor lo nyid //
translated: together with Jina, is below, on wind and a wheel.

original: sngon po la gnas phyag 'tshal sngon ltar dgu po yang //
analyzed: sngon po la gnas phyag 'tshal sngon ltar dgu po yang //
translated: Homage to the one who abides in blue, and so on, for the other nine.

original: lag pa g-yas g-yon sor mo rnam dag lha mo //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas g-yon sor mo rnam dag lha mo //
translated: The pure goddesses of the fingers of the right and left hands

original: aa yig las byung zla ba dbang po'i phyogs gnas //
analyzed: aa yig las byung zla ba dbang po'i phyogs gnas //
translated: are in the directions of the moon and Indra, arisen from the letter A.

original: aa: las byung ba'i snang byed bden bral la gnas //
analyzed: aa: las byung ba'i snang byed bden bral la gnas //
translated: The sun, arisen from A, is in the direction of Agni,🔽and the earth mandala is in the direction of the nadir.

original: de dag sa yi dkyil 'khor gnas la phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: de dag sa yi dkyil 'khor gnas la phyag 'tshal //
translated: Homage to them.🔽The Dharma wheel, the glorious vase, the supreme drum, and the wish-fulfilling tree,

original: h'um yig dang ni aam yig aom yig ho: rnams las byung ba yi //🔽chos kyi 'khor lo dpal gyi bum pa bzang po mchog gi rnga dang // dpag bsam shing rnams dkar min dmar po dkar po ser po rnams ni //
analyzed: h'um yig dang ni aam yig aom yig ho: rnams las byung ba yi // chos kyi 'khor lo dpal gyi bum pa bzang po mchog gi rnga dang // dpag bsam shing rnams dkar min dmar po dkar po ser po rnams ni //
translated: which are arisen from the letters HŪM, A, OṀ, and HO, respectively,

original: rim bzhin shar la sogs pa'i rta babs la gnas rnams la phyag 'tshal //🔽rgyal ba mi bskyod pa la dpal ldan rgyal ba rdo rje sems dpas rgyas ni gdab par bya //
analyzed: rim bzhin shar la sogs pa'i rta babs la gnas rnams la phyag 'tshal // rgyal ba mi bskyod pa la dpal ldan rgyal ba rdo rje sems dpas rgyas ni gdab par bya //
translated: are white, red, white, and yellow, and abide in the archways of the east and so on.🔽Homage to them.🔽The glorious Victor Vajrasattva seals the Victor Akṣobhya.

original: de ni rgyal ba mi bskyod pa ste don grub rgyal ba nor bu'i phyag ldan de nyid kyis //
analyzed: de ni rgyal ba mi bskyod pa ste don grub rgyal ba nor bu'i phyag ldan de nyid kyis //
translated: That is Akṣobhya, and the Victor Amoghasiddhi, who holds a jewel,

original: chu skyes phyag ldan de nyid 'khor lo can no yang ni de yi rgyal ba rnams par shes //
analyzed: chu skyes phyag ldan de nyid 'khor lo can no yang ni de yi rgyal ba rnams par shes //
translated: The one with the lotus in his hand is the same as the one with the wheel, and the other is known as the Victorious One.

original: spyi bo la gnas sgrib pa bral ba so so'i phyag rgya mdzad la dang bas phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: spyi bo la gnas sgrib pa bral ba so so'i phyag rgya mdzad la dang bas phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I bow with devotion to the one who is free from obscurations, who is on the crown of the head, and who makes the individual mudra.

original: nam mkha' dang ni rlung dang sreg byed chu dang sa yi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni rlung dang sreg byed chu dang sa yi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of space, wind, fire, water, and earth,

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i khams rnams las byung bde bar gshegs pa ji lta bu //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i khams rnams las byung bde bar gshegs pa ji lta bu //
translated: the Sugatas arise from the previously mentioned elements.

original: de bzhin 'khor lo 'di las gzhan pa'i lha rnams ma lus pa nyid kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin 'khor lo 'di las gzhan pa'i lha rnams ma lus pa nyid kyi //
translated: In the same way, all the other deities arise from this wheel,

original: con pan mchog las yang dag gnas pa de rnams la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: con pan mchog las yang dag gnas pa de rnams la ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: and they are perfectly situated in the supreme bindu. I bow to them.

original: de ltar phyag btsal nas mchod pa bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ltar phyag btsal nas mchod pa bya ba ni //
translated: Having bowed in this way, one should make offerings,

original: de yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis 'dod pa'i dri ma med par gsungs pa ltar //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis 'dod pa'i dri ma med par gsungs pa ltar //
translated: as stated by Arya Avalokitesvara in the Stainless Light of Desire.

original: de las rgyal ba ma lus mchod pa'i don du spros pa'i 'od zer de rnams slar bkug ste rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i rdo rje la zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de las rgyal ba ma lus mchod pa'i don du spros pa'i 'od zer de rnams slar bkug ste rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i rdo rje la zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to make offerings to all the conquerors, one should imagine that those light rays emanate and reenter the vajra on the moon at one’s heart.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis kyi sa bon gyi yi ge rnams bsams la /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la mchod pa'i lha mo bcu gnyis kyi sa bon gyi yi ge rnams bsams la /
translated: Then, on the moon disk, one should imagine the seed syllables of the twelve offering goddesses.

original: de nas so so'i sa bon las mchod pa'i lha mo rnams spros pa ni /
analyzed: de nas so so'i sa bon las mchod pa'i lha mo rnams spros pa ni /
translated: Then, from each seed syllable, the offering goddesses emanate.
oṃ ca ṭa ta ta oṃ

original: tstshdzdzhnya badzra gandhe gandha aa rtsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: tstshdzdzhnya badzra gandhe gandha aa rtsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: ca ṭa ta ta oṃ vajra gandhe gandhārcanaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tstshadzdzhny'a ru ku ru sv'a h'a /🔽aom tathaddhan'a tathddhana badzra dh'u pe dh'u pa aa tsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tstshadzdzhny'a ru ku ru sv'a h'a / aom tathaddhan'a tathddhana badzra dh'u pe dh'u pa aa tsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ ca ṭa ta ta oṃ vajra puṣpe puṣpārcanaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.🔽oṃ ta ṭha da dha na oṃ vajra dhūpe dhūpārcanaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tathddhn'a badzra pra d'i pe pra d'i pa aa tsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tathddhn'a badzra pra d'i pe pra d'i pa aa tsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ ta ṭha da dha na oṃ vajra pradīpe pradīpārcanaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom phagbham badzra aa mri te nee be dya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom phagbham badzra aa mri te nee be dya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ phaṃ baṃ bhaṃ maṃ oṃ vajra amṛte naivedya pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom papbbham'a badzra aaksha te aaksha ta pha la aa rtsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom papbbham'a badzra aaksha te aaksha ta pha la aa rtsa nam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ pib bhaṃ vajra akṣate akṣata phalārcanaṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tathaddha badzra l'a sye bastra a'a bha ra na p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sva h'a /
analyzed: aom tathaddha badzra l'a sye bastra a'a bha ra na p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sva h'a /
translated: Oṃ tathāddhavajrālāsyai vastrābharaṇapūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom tathddhana badzra h'a sye gha nt'a da rsha p'u dz'a ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom tathddhana badzra h'a sye gha nt'a da rsha p'u dz'a ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tathāddhanavajrahāsye ghaṇṭādṛṣṭipūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: badzra w'a dye p'u dz'a ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: badzra w'a dye p'u dz'a ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tathāddhavajravādyai pūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom kkhagghd'a badzra nri tyam nri tya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom kkhagghd'a badzra nri tyam nri tya p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ kakaghaghadāvajranṛtyanṛtyapūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom swashshyka badzra g'i ti g'i ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom swashshyka badzra g'i ti g'i ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ svāhāthakavajragīti gītapūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: aom swshshthk'a badzra k'a me sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am kro dh'a aa dhi n'am tse ba badzra su ra ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom swshshthk'a badzra k'a me sarba buddha bo dhi satva n'am kro dh'a aa dhi n'am tse ba badzra su ra ta p'u dz'am ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ svāhāthakāvajrakāmā sarvabuddhabodhisattvākrodhādhīnaṃ ceta vajrasuratapūjāṃ kuru kuru svāhā.

original: de ltar sngags kyi rkang pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sngags kyi rkang pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams la yid kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, with the verses of the mantras, one should mentally worship the buddhas and so forth.

original: de nas sdig ba bshags pa ni sdig pa dpag med byas pa rnams //
analyzed: de nas sdig ba bshags pa ni sdig pa dpag med byas pa rnams //
translated: Next, the confession of sins:

original: so so nyid du bshags par bgyi //
analyzed: so so nyid du bshags par bgyi //
translated: I confess each and every sin.

original: bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba ni /
translated: Next, rejoicing in virtue:🔽I rejoice in all the virtue🔽Of the perfect Buddhas,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rnams kyi dge ba dpag med gang byas pa //🔽de rnams kun la rjes su yi rang ba dang sdig bral byang chub spyod la rjes su bzhugs par zhu //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rnams kyi dge ba dpag med gang byas pa // de rnams kun la rjes su yi rang ba dang sdig bral byang chub spyod la rjes su bzhugs par zhu //
translated: Bodhisattvas, and the noble Sangha.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ni /
translated: Next, going for refuge to the Three Jewels:🔽Until I reach enlightenment, I go for refuge🔽To the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha,

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnams la byang chub bar du skyabs su 'chi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnams la byang chub bar du skyabs su 'chi //
translated: Who conquer the fears of samsara.

original: de nas bdag nyid dbul ba dang bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba ni /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid dbul ba dang bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba ni /
translated: Next, offering oneself and dedicating one’s merit:🔽Until enlightenment, I offer my body🔽To the perfect Buddhas,🔽The Bodhisattvas, and the noble Sangha.

original: bdag gi ji srid len gyur lus 'bul sems can ma lus don phyir bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shog / de ltar bdun rnam par dag pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: bdag gi ji srid len gyur lus 'bul sems can ma lus don phyir bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shog / de ltar bdun rnam par dag pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
translated: Having made these seven-branch offerings,

original: de nas rtsa ba gsum dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsa ba gsum dran par bya'o //
translated: Then one should recollect the three roots.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the ten perfections.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the four divine abodes.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the four means of gathering [disciples].

original: mi dge pa bcu yongs su spong ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge pa bcu yongs su spong ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the abandonment of the ten non-virtues.

original: sgrib pa lnga spong ba bsgom par bya'o //🔽nyon mongs pa bzhi spong ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga spong ba bsgom par bya'o // nyon mongs pa bzhi spong ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the abandonment of the five hindrances.🔽One should cultivate the abandonment of the four afflictions.

original: zag pa bzhi spang ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa bzhi spang ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the abandonment of the four outflows.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the four liberations.

original: @110b de ltar bsgom pa la khams gsum g-yo ba dang brtan par bcas pa rnams rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
analyzed: @110b de ltar bsgom pa la khams gsum g-yo ba dang brtan par bcas pa rnams rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
translated: Thus, one should analyze the three realms, both the moving and the stable.

original: dngos med dngos por med pa ste //
analyzed: dngos med dngos por med pa ste //
translated: Non-entity is not an entity.

original: de ltar dngos po'ang dngos por med //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po'ang dngos por med //
translated: Thus, entity is also not an entity.

original: des na dngos po dngos med 'gyur //
analyzed: des na dngos po dngos med 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, entity becomes non-entity.

original: de phyir dngos po dmigs su med //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po dmigs su med //
translated: Therefore, entity is not apprehended.

original: ces pa'o // de nas 'khor ba'i phung po yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa'o // de nas 'khor ba'i phung po yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should abandon the aggregates of cyclic existence.

original: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa ltar dang por 'dir brtul zhugs dang ldan pas lus kyi dbus su chu yis me rnams bshig bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa ltar dang por 'dir brtul zhugs dang ldan pas lus kyi dbus su chu yis me rnams bshig bar byed pa'o //
translated: As it is said in that (Tantra), first of all, one who is endowed with the observances should destroy the fires with water in the middle of the body.

original: de nas me'i dngos po med pa las sa'i sra ba spangs nas tshva bzhin du zhu ste /
analyzed: de nas me'i dngos po med pa las sa'i sra ba spangs nas tshva bzhin du zhu ste /
translated: Then, from the non-existence of the element of fire, having abandoned the solidity of earth, (the water) dissolves like salt.

original: chu'i dbus su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i dbus su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It enters into the middle of the water.

original: de nas yang chu rnams rlung gis bskams te nam mkha' la thim par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de nas yang chu rnams rlung gis bskams te nam mkha' la thim par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Then again, the water is dried up by the wind and dissolves into space.

original: de ltar khams kyi tshogs rnams myur bar rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar khams kyi tshogs rnams myur bar rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the collection of elements quickly dissolves.🔽Then,

original: de nas / sems dang me nyid mun pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: de nas / sems dang me nyid mun pa'i mtha' //
translated: mind, fire, and darkness

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus kyi gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha'i khams kyi dbus kyi gnas so //
translated: are in the middle of the space element.

original: yul dang bral ba zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan kun gzhi rnam par shes par gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang bral ba zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan kun gzhi rnam par shes par gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Free from objects means that the reflection of all aspects should be grasped in the foundation consciousness.

original: de nas sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sngags 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should recite this mantra:

original: aom sh'u nya t'a dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom sh'u nya t'a dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ śūnyatājñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: aom aa ni mitta dzny'ana badzra sva a'atma konya ham /🔽aom aa pra ni hi ta dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom aa ni mitta dzny'ana badzra sva a'atma konya ham / aom aa pra ni hi ta dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ animittajñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.🔽Oṃ apraṇihitavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: aom aa n'a bhi sam sak'a ra dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom aa n'a bhi sam sak'a ra dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Oṃ anābhogajñānavajrasvabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: zhes brjod la /
analyzed: zhes brjod la /
translated: Recite this.

original: khams gsum po rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa'i stong pa'i rnam par bsam mo //
analyzed: khams gsum po rdul phra rab kyi chos nyid las 'das pa'i stong pa'i rnam par bsam mo //
translated: The three realms are beyond the dharmatā of subtle particles, and one should imagine them as empty.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs nas chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i don du mngal du 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das sngon gyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs nas chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i don du mngal du 'jug pa'i tshul gyis bskyed pa ni /
translated: Next, in order for the Bhagavān to turn the wheel of dharma after the fulfillment of his previous aspirations, one should generate the womb-entrance:

original: nam mkha'i khams dpag pa las 'das pa bltas la sngon du brjod pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi la sogs pa bsam mo /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams dpag pa las 'das pa bltas la sngon du brjod pa'i rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi la sogs pa bsam mo /
translated: Gaze into the sky, which is beyond measure, and imagine the four maṇḍalas of wind, and so on, as previously described.

original: hkshmlwr+yam de nas rdo rje'i sa gzhi'i dbus su gzhal yas khang bsam pa ni /
analyzed: hkshmlwr+yam de nas rdo rje'i sa gzhi'i dbus su gzhal yas khang bsam pa ni /
translated: Then, in the center of the vajra ground, one should imagine the celestial mansion.

original: bh'um yig gam aom yig yongs su gyur pa las thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid gru bzhi pa'i rten bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bh'um yig gam aom yig yongs su gyur pa las thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo gsum gyi bdag nyid gru bzhi pa'i rten bsam par bya'o //
translated: From the transformation of the syllable bhrūṃ or the syllable oṃ, one should imagine the foundation, which is the nature of the three wheels of mind, speech, and body.

original: de yang thugs kyi 'khor lo la rab nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po gsum gyis bskor bsgo bzhi pa kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
analyzed: de yang thugs kyi 'khor lo la rab nag po dang dmar po dang dkar po gsum gyis bskor bsgo bzhi pa kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i rta babs bzhis brgyan pa /
translated: That is to say, the wheel of mind is surrounded by three layers: black, red, and white. It has four corners, is adorned with four gates having various colors, and is ornamented with four porticos.

original: phyi rol du 'dod yon dang / rin chen pha gu dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed ba dang / ba ku li dang / kra ma shirshasa spras pa /
analyzed: phyi rol du 'dod yon dang / rin chen pha gu dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed ba dang / ba ku li dang / kra ma shirshasa spras pa /
translated: Outside, it is adorned with the five sense offerings, a jeweled beam, a net, half-nets, a garland, and a kramaśira.

original: zla ba dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / me long dang / rnga yab la sogs pas rnam par brgyan pa /🔽de'i @111a * //
analyzed: zla ba dang / rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / me long dang / rnga yab la sogs pas rnam par brgyan pa / de'i @111a * //
translated: It is adorned with moons, victory banners, bells, mirrors, yak-tail fans, and so on.

original: nang gi phyed ye shes kyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: nang gi phyed ye shes kyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Half of that is the wheel of pristine consciousness.

original: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba ka ba bcu drug gis spras pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba ka ba bcu drug gis spras pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with sixteen pillars surrounded by a vajra garland.

original: de nyid kyi phyed ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas te rdo rje phreng bas bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyed ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gnas te rdo rje phreng bas bskor ba'o //
translated: Half of that is the abode of the Bhagavān, surrounded by a vajra garland.

original: de ltar thugs kyi 'khor lo rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thugs kyi 'khor lo rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the mind wheel.

original: de'i nyis 'gyur gsung gi 'khor lo rab lnga yis bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i nyis 'gyur gsung gi 'khor lo rab lnga yis bskor ba'o //
translated: Twice that is the speech wheel, surrounded by five layers.

original: de ltar nyis 'gyur gyi sgo bzhi la sogs pa rnga yab kyi bar gyis mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyis 'gyur gyi sgo bzhi la sogs pa rnga yab kyi bar gyis mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, twice that is adorned with four gates, and so on, up to the yak-tail fans.

original: de'i phyi rol du sku'i 'khor lo la de nyid nyis 'gyur gyi tshad kyis te /
analyzed: de'i phyi rol du sku'i 'khor lo la de nyid nyis 'gyur gyi tshad kyis te /
translated: Outside of that, the body wheel is twice the size of that.

original: rab lnga dang sgo bzhi la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rab lnga dang sgo bzhi la sogs pas mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: It is adorned with five layers, four gates, and so on.

original: thams cad kyi shar dang me mtshams kyis gzhi nag po'o //🔽lho dang bden bral gyis gzhi dmar po'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi shar dang me mtshams kyis gzhi nag po'o // lho dang bden bral gyis gzhi dmar po'o //
translated: The base of all of them is black in the east and southeast.🔽The base is red in the south and southwest.

original: nub dang rlung mtshams kyis gzhi ser po'o //
analyzed: nub dang rlung mtshams kyis gzhi ser po'o //
translated: The base is yellow in the west and northwest.

original: byang dang dbang ldan gyi sa gzhi dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang dang dbang ldan gyi sa gzhi dkar po'o //
translated: The base is white in the north and northeast.

original: phyi rol du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Externally, the circles of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: rdo rje'i phreng ba dang / rdo rje'i me ri dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng ba dang / rdo rje'i me ri dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: The garland of vajras, the vajra-ring of fire, and the great charnel ground located in the circle of wind.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: Having thus meditated on the circle of the mandala,

original: phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad par bshad pa'i bzhugs gnas rnams su gdan rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lha rnams rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad par bshad pa'i bzhugs gnas rnams su gdan rnams ji lta ba bzhin du lha rnams rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: one should visualize the deities in their respective seats, in the abodes explained in the verses of homage.

original: de rnams las thugs kyi 'khor lo la bam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams la gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams las thugs kyi 'khor lo la bam yig yongs su gyur pa las padma nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams la gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: From those, in the mind circle, one should meditate on the twenty-four moon and sun seats arisen from the transformation of the syllable vaṃ.

original: padma re re la rtsa ba dang / ra ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze 'bru dang / lte ba rnams kyi sa bon rnams gzhung ches kyis dogs nas ma bris te /
analyzed: padma re re la rtsa ba dang / ra ba dang / 'dab ma dang / ze 'bru dang / lte ba rnams kyi sa bon rnams gzhung ches kyis dogs nas ma bris te /
translated: For each lotus, the seed syllables of the root, wall, petals, pistil cup, and center are not written here for fear of being too wordy.

original: de yang gzhan cung zad tsam brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang gzhan cung zad tsam brjod pa ni /
translated: And a little more is said about that:

original: padma'i rtsa ba dang ra ba dag las aa yig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba dang ra ba dag las aa yig las byung ba'o //
translated: The root and stem of the lotus arise from the letter A.

original: 'dab ma dang ge sar dag au yig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma dang ge sar dag au yig las byung ba'o //
translated: The petals and filaments arise from the letter U.

original: de'i dbus su lte ba la aa yig las zla ba'i gdan no //
analyzed: de'i dbus su lte ba la aa yig las zla ba'i gdan no //
translated: In the center of that, on the navel, is a moon seat from the letter A.

original: ram yig las nyi ma'i gdan no //
analyzed: ram yig las nyi ma'i gdan no //
translated: A sun seat arises from the letter Ra.

original: de nas gtso bo'i padma nyi ma nyi shu rtsa lnga pa aom yig yongs su gyur pa las te /
analyzed: de nas gtso bo'i padma nyi ma nyi shu rtsa lnga pa aom yig yongs su gyur pa las te /
translated: Then, from the twenty-five suns of the principal lotus, there is a transformation into the letter Om.

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / sgra gcan dang / dus me'i dkyil 'khor bzhi dang bcas pa bsgom par byas nas /
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / sgra gcan dang / dus me'i dkyil 'khor bzhi dang bcas pa bsgom par byas nas /
translated: Having meditated on the four mandalas of the moon, sun, Rahu, and Kālāgni,

original: rdo rje shugs kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs su bshad pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes lnga rdzogs pa dang / phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sna tshogs yum gyis 'khyud par bdag @111b nyed bsams la /
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi skabs su bshad pa ltar me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pa ye shes lnga rdzogs pa dang / phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid du gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i sna tshogs yum gyis 'khyud par bdag @111b nyed bsams la /
translated: As explained in the context of the vajra-speed meditative stabilization, one imagines oneself as the Bhagavān Kālacakra, complete with the five pristine awarenesses, such as the mirror-like pristine awareness, and so forth, and endowed with the characteristics described in the verses of homage, embraced by Viśvamātā, endowed with the characteristics described in the same [verses of homage].

original: nag mo 'bar ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad dang / rin po che la sogs pa'i mtshan ma blta bar byas pa 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: nag mo 'bar ma la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad dang / rin po che la sogs pa'i mtshan ma blta bar byas pa 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa'o //
translated: One should view the eight goddesses, such as Kṛiṣṇābha, and the emblems, such as the jewel. This is the generation of Vajrasattva.

original: de nas sbyor ba'i sgra mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams bdag nyid kyi lus la gzhug par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba'i sgra mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rgyal ba'i tshogs rnams bdag nyid kyi lus la gzhug par byas nas /
translated: Then, one should cause the assembly of victors, such as Akṣobhya, to enter one’s body through the sound of union.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i tshogs skyes bu dang rig ma dang / mig la sogs pa dang / yul rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi lha nyid du bskyed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa'i tshogs skyes bu dang rig ma dang / mig la sogs pa dang / yul rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi lha nyid du bskyed do //
translated: The assembly of space and so forth are the male and female beings, the eyes and so forth, and the nature of the objects are the deities.

original: yang de rnams rang gi lus las phyung ste //
analyzed: yang de rnams rang gi lus las phyung ste //
translated: Then, having emanated them from one's body,

original: sna tshogs yum la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs yum la ji lta ba bzhin du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: they should be inserted into the mother of variety just as before.

original: de nas yang de ltar spros la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang gi lus la bcug la /
analyzed: de nas yang de ltar spros la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rang gi lus la bcug la /
translated: Then, having emanated them in that way, the mandala wheel of the tathagatas should be inserted into one's body.

original: rang gi rdo rje las spros te rang gi rig ma'i padma'i dbus so //
analyzed: rang gi rdo rje las spros te rang gi rig ma'i padma'i dbus so //
translated: Having emanated them from one's vajra, they are in the center of one's knowledge consort's lotus.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las lha nyid kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang rten pa ste /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las lha nyid kyi dkyil 'khor rten dang rten pa ste /
translated: From their complete transformation, the mandala of the deity is the support and the supported.

original: lhag pa'i gtso bor mi bskyod pa bsams nas /
analyzed: lhag pa'i gtso bor mi bskyod pa bsams nas /
translated: Having visualized Akshobhya as the supreme principal,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gzhug par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku la gzhug par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: the Bhagavat should be inserted into one's body.

original: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid la gnas par byas nas /
analyzed: de nas sngar gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid la gnas par byas nas /
translated: Then, having made the mandala master abide with the characteristics previously explained,

original: de nas aom su bi shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: de nas aom su bi shuddha dharm'a dh'a tu dzny'ana badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: Then, “oṃ suviśuddhadharmadhātujñānavajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.”🔽

original: zhes pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //
translated: Then one should perform the pride with the mantra, “Oṃ, I am the purified nature of phenomena, the wisdom vajra.”

original: de nas sems can thams cad la snying rjes dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas sems can thams cad la snying rjes dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should consecrate all sentient beings with compassion.

original: de yang de nyid las 'di ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang de nyid las 'di ltar gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in that very [Hevajra Tantra]:

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo la ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i cod pan can /
translated: The Bhagavān Kālacakra has the nature of the five wisdoms, the diadem of Vajrasattva,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: and the nature of the completely pure dharmadhātu.

original: de nas 'gro ba rigs drug gi gnas nas sems can thams cad bkug ste /
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba rigs drug gi gnas nas sems can thams cad bkug ste /
translated: Then all sentient beings are summoned from the abodes of the six classes of beings,

original: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du zhugs par rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and they are imagined to have entered the maṇḍala.

original: de nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rnams dang bcas pa rnams rang gi snying gar zhu ste /
analyzed: de nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rnams dang bcas pa rnams rang gi snying gar zhu ste /
translated: Then all the tathāgatas, such as Vairocana, together with the dhātu, melt into one’s heart center,

original: byang chub sems su zhu ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems su zhu ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa /
translated: and one becomes the nature of the melted bodhicitta.

original: rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje nas spros pa'i byang chub sems des /
analyzed: rang gi gsang ba'i rdo rje nas spros pa'i byang chub sems des /
translated: The bodhicitta that emanates from one’s secret vajra🔽

original: sems can thams cad la dbang bskur bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dbang bskur bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the bodhicitta that emanates from one’s secret vajra confers empowerment on all sentient beings.

original: de nas byang chub sems kyi 'od zer de rnams reg pas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems kyi 'od zer de rnams reg pas /
translated: Then, by the touch of those light rays of bodhicitta,

original: zhal gsum pa dang zhal sna tshogs pa dang / kha dog sna tshogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa dga' ba'i bde bas gang bar bsgom par bya'o //🔽de nas de rnams rang rang ge lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du skad cig gis @112a * //
analyzed: zhal gsum pa dang zhal sna tshogs pa dang / kha dog sna tshogs pa'i lha'i rang bzhin thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid mchog tu gyur pa dga' ba'i bde bas gang bar bsgom par bya'o // de nas de rnams rang rang ge lus kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin du skad cig gis @112a * //
translated: one should meditate on the supreme nature of method and wisdom, filled with the bliss of supreme joy, with various faces and various colors, the nature of the deity.

original: blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, in an instant, one should view them as the nature of the maṇḍala wheels of their individual bodies.

original: de nas sngags kyi sa bon rnams gsal byed sna tshogs 'dus pa dang dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams te /
analyzed: de nas sngags kyi sa bon rnams gsal byed sna tshogs 'dus pa dang dbyangs dang bcas pa rnams te /
translated: Then, the seed syllables of the mantra are the collection of various consonants and vowels.

original: 'dir gsal byed thams cad 'dus pa ksha yig go //
analyzed: 'dir gsal byed thams cad 'dus pa ksha yig go //
translated: Here, the collection of all consonants is the syllable kṣa.

original: de nyid kyis gzhan yang shes par byed pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis gzhan yang shes par byed pas /
translated: Since that itself is understood by others,

original: gang dang gang gi ming gi yi ge dang po de gsal byed de /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi ming gi yi ge dang po de gsal byed de /
translated: The first letter of any name is a sibilant.

original: de ltar thams cad go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thams cad go bar bya'o //
translated: All should be understood in this way.

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: And this is how it is:

analyzed: lha rnams ni rnam par thar pa bzhi'i stobs kyis te /

original: 'dir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden ba zhes bya ba'o //

translated: From among those, the nose-tip of the source of the phenomena of wisdom is known to be the provisional meaning, and the certainty of the mustard seed, etc.,🔽is the definitive meaning.🔽Here, the vajra-holder moves in the womb,

analyzed: zhes pa'i nga rgyal bya'o //

analyzed: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /

analyzed: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dus su yang de'i rang bzhin bdag nyid du bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs par nges pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, at the time of the creation stage, the Bhagavān has stated that one should be of that nature.”

original: nges pa'i don du sngags bzlas pa ni srog mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don du sngags bzlas pa ni srog mnyam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The recitation of the mantra in the definitive meaning is the life-force in equipoise.

original: dgang ba dang dbyung ba dang / bum pa can gyi sbyor ba la dus thams cad du bsnyen par byas pas /
analyzed: dgang ba dang dbyung ba dang / bum pa can gyi sbyor ba la dus thams cad du bsnyen par byas pas /

original: de nyid kyis lha'i mchog ster bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyis lha'i mchog ster bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /

analyzed: srog ma spyi pa dang / ngag gi brjod pa dang bcas pas nges pa'i don la ma yin te /
translated: Not by the life-force, not by the utterance of speech, not by the definitive meaning,

analyzed: des na sgrub pa'i thabs kyi bye brag gi sbyor ba'i yan lag drug mdor bstan pa tsam las ma bris pa ni gzhung ches kyis dogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I have not written more than just a brief presentation of the six-branched yoga of the method of practice, fearing the text would become too long.

original: drang don ltar na thun mong bsgrub pa'i don du phreng ba dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: drang don ltar na thun mong bsgrub pa'i don du phreng ba dang bcas pas sngags bzlas pa ste /

analyzed: de yang zhib dang rgyas pa la phyogs pas mu tig gam shel gyi phreng ba dang bcas pas /

original: sngags bzlas pa ni /
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa ni /

original: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag drug gi sngags 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag drug gi sngags 'di lta ste /

original: aom hr'am hr'im hum hl'im hr'am sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom hr'am hr'im hum hl'im hr'am sv'a h'a /

analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags 'di'i mthar na mo bcug pas zhi bar 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar lha rnams gshegs par bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de ltar lha rnams gshegs par bya ba ni ;
translated: Thus, the deities should be sent away.

original: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is stated in that [text]:

analyzed: 'dir dkyil 'khor rgyal mchog dang / las rgyal mchog dang / thig le'i rnal 'byor dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor rnams bsgoms nas mchod pa bya ste /
translated: Here, one should make offerings after meditating on the supreme royal mandala, the supreme royal activities, the yoga of the drop, and the subtle yoga.

original: bstod pa bya ba ni /
analyzed: bstod pa bya ba ni /
translated: The praise:

analyzed: mchog sbyin rdo rje mchog khyod 'dud //

original: ces ba la sogs pas bstod nas /
analyzed: ces ba la sogs pas bstod nas /

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams gshegs su gsol ba ni /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams gshegs su gsol ba ni /
translated: then one should request the departure of the mandala deities.

original: gtsug tor du rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor du rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: One should request the departure of the wheel of great bliss at the navel of the five-tined vajra meditated at the crown.

original: de ltar snying ga chos kyi 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo dgu pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la du ba ma la sogs pa rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
