translated: In that way, one should request the departure of smoke and so forth at the navel of the nine-tined vajra meditated at the dharmacakra of the heart.

original: de ltar dpral bar lhan cig skyes pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo bcu bdun pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la phung po dang khams kyi lha rnams gshegs par bya'o //🔽de ltar mgrin pa longs spyod 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gsum pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la skye mched bcu @116a * //
analyzed: de ltar dpral bar lhan cig skyes pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo bcu bdun pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la phung po dang khams kyi lha rnams gshegs par bya'o // de ltar mgrin pa longs spyod 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gsum pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la skye mched bcu @116a * //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the wheel of the simultaneously born [at the forehead], with seventeen spokes, and invite the deities of the aggregates and constituents into its center.

original: gnyis kyi lha khro bo rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi lha khro bo rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the wheel of enjoyment [at the throat], with thirty-three spokes, and invite the wrathful deities of the twelve sense bases into its center.

original: de ltar lte bar sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la tsa munda la sogs pa dang / 'jigs byed ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lte bar sprul pa'i 'khor lo la rdo rje rtse mo drug cu rtsa lnga pa bsgoms pa dang / de'i lte ba la tsa munda la sogs pa dang / 'jigs byed ma la sogs pa'i lha rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the emanation wheel [at the navel], with sixty-five spokes, and invite the deities such as Caṇḍa and Bhairavī into its center.

original: de ltar gsang bar rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gsum pa bsgom pa dang / de'i lte ba la 'od zer can ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsang bar rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gsum pa bsgom pa dang / de'i lte ba la 'od zer can ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should visualize the thirty-three-spoked vajra [at the secret place], and invite the goddesses such as Māmakī into its center.

original: de ltar las kyi 'khor lo rnams la rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gcig pa rnams bsgom pa dang / phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad par gsungs pa ltar khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha bcu gnyis 'khor dang bcas pa rnams /
analyzed: de ltar las kyi 'khor lo rnams la rdo rje rtse mo sum cu so gcig pa rnams bsgom pa dang / phyag btsal ba'i tshigs su bcad par gsungs pa ltar khyab 'jug la sogs pa'i lha bcu gnyis 'khor dang bcas pa rnams /
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the thirty-one vajra-peaks in the wheels of karma, and the twelve gods such as Vishnu, and so forth, together with their retinues, as taught in the verses of homage.

original: de rnams kyi lte ba rnams la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lte ba rnams la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: One should request the departure of those deities in the centers of those wheels.

original: de ltar las kyi 'khor lo rnam la rdo rje rtse mo bdun pa rnams bsgom pa dang / klu rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha de rnams lte ba rnams la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar las kyi 'khor lo rnam la rdo rje rtse mo bdun pa rnams bsgom pa dang / klu rnams dang khyi gdong ma la sogs pa'i lha de rnams lte ba rnams la gshegs su gsol bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the seven vajra-peaks in the wheels of karma, and request the departure of those deities such as the nagas and the dog-faced goddess, and so forth, in the centers of those wheels.

original: de nas thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom par mi nus pa'i gang zag dbang po tha ma 'ga' zhig gis /
analyzed: de nas thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom par mi nus pa'i gang zag dbang po tha ma 'ga' zhig gis /
translated: Then, some persons of average capacity who are unable to meditate on the wheel of the mandala that is the nature of the wheels of mind, speech, and body,

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i thugs kyi dkyil 'khor bsgom pa ste /
translated: should meditate on the mandala of mind as previously taught.

original: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: And that is taught in the same tantra:

original: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padma'i gdan la gnas pa'i du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad dang / bum pa brgyad dang / chos kyi dung la sogs pa bzhin rnams sbangs pa ni /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bdag po'i padma'i gdan la gnas pa'i du ba la sogs pa'i lha mo brgyad dang / bum pa brgyad dang / chos kyi dung la sogs pa bzhin rnams sbangs pa ni /
translated: The eight goddesses such as Tuṣita, who are seated on the lotus seats of the lords of the victors, and the eight pitchers, and the Dharma conch, etc., are the perfections.

original: dpal ldan snying po'i 'khor lo ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su lha nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan snying po'i 'khor lo ni thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su lha nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The glorious essence wheel is in the center of the mind mandala, which is the nature of twenty-five deities.

original: mi'i bdag po kye zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi'i bdag po kye zhes pa ni /
translated: O lord of men!

original: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'khor lo bzhugs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān is seated in the Kālacakra.

original: de'i tshe dpal 'dus pa bzhin 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dpal 'dus pa bzhin 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: At that time, it is like the glorious Guhyasamāja.

original: 'dir nges pa med de rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir nges pa med de rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Here there is no certainty, because there is no connection.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das rang sems nus ma dang ldan pa 'dir yang shes par byas la rnal 'byor rnams kyi ni sgrub pa po rnams kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das rang sems nus ma dang ldan pa 'dir yang shes par byas la rnal 'byor rnams kyi ni sgrub pa po rnams kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān, who is endowed with the power of his own mind, should be understood here, and the yogis, the adepts, should meditate.

original: dbang gi don du rigs kyi dbang las phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang gi don du rigs kyi dbang las phyi'i dkyil 'khor dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: For the purpose of empowerment, the wheel itself, which is free from the external wheel due to the empowerment of the family, becomes the wheel.

original: yang 'dir sngon du gsungs pa ltar lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par dag pa la sogs pa nas lha rnams gshegs pa'i bar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'dir sngon du gsungs pa ltar lus dang ngag dang yid rnam par dag pa la sogs pa nas lha rnams gshegs pa'i bar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, here one should cultivate the body, speech, and mind as pure, and so forth, up to the arrival of the deities, as previously explained.

original: der gshegs su gsol bar byas nas /
analyzed: der gshegs su gsol bar byas nas /
translated: Having invited them to arrive,

original: de nas aom h'um phat ces pa'i nga rgyal byas pa dang / gtor ma @116b sbyin no //
analyzed: de nas aom h'um phat ces pa'i nga rgyal byas pa dang / gtor ma @116b sbyin no //
translated: then one should make the offering of the sacrificial cake, with the pride of saying “Oṃ hūṃ phaṭ.”

original: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang de nyid las gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, that same [Hevajra Tantra] teaches:

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas mtshams gsum du gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i cho gas mtshams gsum du gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “One should make the offering of the sacrificial cake in the three boundaries, with the rite previously explained.”

original: sngon du gsungs pa'i chogs dam tshig gi rdzas rnam par dag par byas la /
analyzed: sngon du gsungs pa'i chogs dam tshig gi rdzas rnam par dag par byas la /
translated: Having purified the pledge substances with the rite previously explained,

original: lha'i tshogs rnams mnyes par bya ba'i don du gtor ma 'bul ba ni /
analyzed: lha'i tshogs rnams mnyes par bya ba'i don du gtor ma 'bul ba ni /
translated: one should offer the sacrificial cake for the purpose of pleasing the hosts of deities.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho:/
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho:/
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hoḥ.

original: rim par gnas pas dang po 'dir ni rtag tu dag bya sel bar bya ba dang // rab tu sbar bya nyid dang ri bong can zhu lta bu ma lus rim pas chang la bsgom byas la //
analyzed: rim par gnas pas dang po 'dir ni rtag tu dag bya sel bar bya ba dang // rab tu sbar bya nyid dang ri bong can zhu lta bu ma lus rim pas chang la bsgom byas la //
translated: The one to be purified, the one to be removed, the one to be ignited, and the one to be melted like the moon, all in sequence, should be cultivated in the beer.

original: snod de las ni nges par ri bong can gyi lag pa'i ming med rtse mos la thig le nyid //
analyzed: snod de las ni nges par ri bong can gyi lag pa'i ming med rtse mos la thig le nyid //
translated: From that vessel, the drop is certainly drawn up by the tip of the rabbit-holder's hand.

original: nyin phyed dang ni mtshungs pa'i dbus su zlum po yin te de yi phyi ru gru gsum byas pa la //
analyzed: nyin phyed dang ni mtshungs pa'i dbus su zlum po yin te de yi phyi ru gru gsum byas pa la //
translated: In the middle, which is like midday, it is round, and outside of that, it is triangular.

original: de yi dbus su ye shes 'khor lo srid gsum la gnas pa yang sngags pa rnams kyis 'dir bsgoms nas //
analyzed: de yi dbus su ye shes 'khor lo srid gsum la gnas pa yang sngags pa rnams kyis 'dir bsgoms nas //
translated: In the middle of that, the yoginīs and yogins should meditate on the wheel of wisdom, which is located in the three existences.

original: mthe bong dang ni srin lag gis ni nyi ma so so'i dus su tshim pa la sogs bya ba ni //
analyzed: mthe bong dang ni srin lag gis ni nyi ma so so'i dus su tshim pa la sogs bya ba ni //
translated: With the thumb and the ring finger, at each time of the day, one should perform the satisfaction, etc.

original: 'dir ni sngon du yul dang grong gi bdag po rnams la dang po dbus mtha'i ming gis gtor ma dbul //
analyzed: 'dir ni sngon du yul dang grong gi bdag po rnams la dang po dbus mtha'i ming gis gtor ma dbul //
translated: Here, first, one should offer a bali to the lords of the land and the town, with the name of the central place.

original: 'phrog mal yang chad bu gnyis dang gzhan yang khro bo'i rgyal po'i ched du sngags pas gtor ma'o //
analyzed: 'phrog mal yang chad bu gnyis dang gzhan yang khro bo'i rgyal po'i ched du sngags pas gtor ma'o //
translated: One should also offer a bali to Hārītī and her children, and also for the Lord of Wrath.

original: pho nya rnams la zas kyi rtse mos stengs rnams su bzhag ste khyab bdag rdo rje rnams kyis sbyin //
analyzed: pho nya rnams la zas kyi rtse mos stengs rnams su bzhag ste khyab bdag rdo rje rnams kyis sbyin //
translated: The messengers are placed in the directions with the tip of the food. The all-pervading lord should give it with the vajra.

original: zos pa'i lhag ma 'byung po rnams la sbyin te gzhan yang dge ba'i don du sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad brjod //
analyzed: zos pa'i lhag ma 'byung po rnams la sbyin te gzhan yang dge ba'i don du sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad brjod //
translated: The remainder of what has been eaten is given to the spirits.

original: nyal ba'i dus su 'khrig pa'i mchod pa byas nas yan lag kha dang gnyis kyi rigs rnams nyid dang ni //
analyzed: nyal ba'i dus su 'khrig pa'i mchod pa byas nas yan lag kha dang gnyis kyi rigs rnams nyid dang ni //
translated: Having made the offering of sexual union at the time of going to sleep, one should arrange the limbs of the vajra body in the two families of mouth and anus,

original: rang gi mgo dang mgrin pa snying ga lte gsang spyi bo'i 'khor lo rnams la rdo rje'i yan lag dgod //🔽ces pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mgo dang mgrin pa snying ga lte gsang spyi bo'i 'khor lo rnams la rdo rje'i yan lag dgod // ces pa ste /
translated: and the limbs of the vajra body in the wheels of the head, throat, heart, navel, and secret place.

original: de nas aa yig las byung ba'i bum pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de nas aa yig las byung ba'i bum pa gsum mo //
translated: Then, from the syllable A, there are three vases.

original: de rnams kyi steng du aom yig las byung ba'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi steng du aom yig las byung ba'i thod pa'o //
translated: Above them, from the syllable Om, there is a skull cup.

original: nang na gnas pa ni phung po dang khams kyi sa bon rnams las byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga rnams so //
analyzed: nang na gnas pa ni phung po dang khams kyi sa bon rnams las byung ba'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga rnams so //
translated: Inside it, from the seeds of the aggregates and constituents, there are the five nectars and the five lamps.

original: de rnams kyi 'og tu gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis rab tu sbar ba'i mes bzhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'og tu gnas pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis rab tu sbar ba'i mes bzhu bar bya'o //
translated: The fire, which is below them, is ignited by the wind mandala.

original: de nyid h'um yig las byung ba'i rdo rjes dkrug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid h'um yig las byung ba'i rdo rjes dkrug par bya'o //
translated: That is churned by the vajra, which arises from the syllable Hum.

original: de dang bcas pa'i ro gcig tu gyur pas zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs su blta'o //
analyzed: de dang bcas pa'i ro gcig tu gyur pas zla ba zhu ba'i gzugs su blta'o //
translated: Together with that, the moon becomes a single taste, and one should view it in the form of a melting moon.

original: de nas rnam par dag par bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang ba brjod pa /
analyzed: de nas rnam par dag par bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags kyi rkang ba brjod pa /
translated: Then, one should recite the mantra lines for purification and so forth:

original: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dha rmm'a su bi shuddha:/🔽sva bh'a ba sarba dha rm'a na bi sho dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aom badzra tsandra sarba dha rmm'a su bi shuddha:/ sva bh'a ba sarba dha rm'a na bi sho dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ oṃ vajra candra all phenomena are completely pure.🔽Svabhāva sarva dharmas viśodhaya svāhā.🔽Oṃ āḥ vajra sūrya all phenomena are illuminating.

original: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dha rmm'a pra bo dha k'a sarba dharm'a na pra po dha ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: badzra s'u rya sarba dha rmm'a pra bo dha k'a sarba dharm'a na pra po dha ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Illuminate all phenomena. Svāhā.

original: aom h'um badzr'a na la sarba dha rmm'a pra d'i ba ka sarba dha rmm'am pra d'i pa la ya sv'a h'a /🔽aom ho sarba @117a * //
analyzed: aom h'um badzr'a na la sarba dha rmm'a pra d'i ba ka sarba dha rmm'am pra d'i pa la ya sv'a h'a / aom ho sarba @117a * //
translated: Oṃ hūṃ vajra na la all phenomena are illuminating.🔽Illuminate all phenomena. Svāhā.🔽Oṃ hoḥ all phenomena are vajra nectar.

original: dharmm'a badzr'a mri ta ka ra sarba dha rm'a na badzr'a mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
analyzed: dharmm'a badzr'a mri ta ka ra sarba dha rm'a na badzr'a mri tam ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a /
translated: Make all phenomena vajra nectar. Kuru kuru svāhā.

original: zhes pa rnams kyis lag pa g-yon pas rnam par dgab par bya ba dang / lag pa g-yas pas spel bar bya ba dang / thal mos kha bcad de reg pas rab tu sbar bar bya ba dang / rdo rje bya khyung gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rnams kyis lag pa g-yon pas rnam par dgab par bya ba dang / lag pa g-yas pas spel bar bya ba dang / thal mos kha bcad de reg pas rab tu sbar bar bya ba dang / rdo rje bya khyung gi phyag rgyas rdo rje bdud rtsir bya'o //
translated: With these, one should cover with the left hand, increase with the right hand, ignite by touching with the cupped hands, and transform into vajra nectar with the vajra garuḍa mudra.

original: gzhan yang khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas yul gyi bdag po spyan drang bar bya ba dang / khyi'i phyag rgyas grong gi bdag po rnams la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgyas yul gyi bdag po spyan drang bar bya ba dang / khyi'i phyag rgyas grong gi bdag po rnams la'o //
translated: Moreover, one should invite the lords of the directions with the mudra of Trailokyavijaya, the lords of the villages with the dog mudra,

original: rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la'o //
analyzed: rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgyas khro bo'i rgyal po rnams la'o //
translated: the lords of wrath with the five-pointed mudra,

original: gri gug gi phyag rgyas zad par rnams la'o //
analyzed: gri gug gi phyag rgyas zad par rnams la'o //
translated: the all-pervading ones with the curved knife mudra,

original: ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha rnams la'o //🔽rin po che'i phyag rgyas gza' rnams la'o //
analyzed: ral gri'i phyag rgyas lha rnams la'o // rin po che'i phyag rgyas gza' rnams la'o //
translated: the gods with the sword mudra,🔽the planets with the jewel mudra,

original: padma'i phyag rgyas klu rnams la'o //
analyzed: padma'i phyag rgyas klu rnams la'o //
translated: the nāgas with the lotus mudra,

original: 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas 'byung po rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i phyag rgyas 'byung po rnams la'o //
translated: and the bhūtas with the wheel mudra.

original: de yang aom a'a: h'um aa mu ka a'a gtstsha a'a gtstsha sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihan grihan bu ktv'a p'i tv'a tri ptam kri tv'a sarba stva n'am sh'anti tsittam kri tv'a aa pa ra sath'a nam gtstsha gtstsha sv'a h'a /
analyzed: de yang aom a'a: h'um aa mu ka a'a gtstsha a'a gtstsha sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihan grihan bu ktv'a p'i tv'a tri ptam kri tv'a sarba stva n'am sh'anti tsittam kri tv'a aa pa ra sath'a nam gtstsha gtstsha sv'a h'a /
translated: Also, Om Ah Hum, summon such and such, summon, Shighram, accept this food, accept, eat, drink, satisfy, pacify the minds of all beings, go, go to the other side, svaha.

original: zhes pa gtor ma'i sngags 'dis yul gyi bdag po dang / grong gi bdag po'am de ltar yul lam /
analyzed: zhes pa gtor ma'i sngags 'dis yul gyi bdag po dang / grong gi bdag po'am de ltar yul lam /
translated: Moreover, with the mantra of the bali offering, “Oṃ āḥ hūṃ summon summon such-and-such, svāhā,” one should offer the bali to the lords of the region, the lords of the town, and so forth.

original: grong gi ming gi yi ge gang yang rung ba gsum dang lnga dang bdun yin na /
analyzed: grong gi ming gi yi ge gang yang rung ba gsum dang lnga dang bdun yin na /
translated: If the name of the region or town has three, five, or seven syllables,

original: de yang ming gi yi ge dang po dang / dbus dang mtha' ma rnams bcug ste /🔽gtor ma rnams sbyin no //
analyzed: de yang ming gi yi ge dang po dang / dbus dang mtha' ma rnams bcug ste / gtor ma rnams sbyin no //
translated: one should insert the first, middle, and last syllables of the name.

original: gal te de gnyis dang bzhi dang / drug la sogs pa mnyam pa'i ming gi yi ge yin na /
analyzed: gal te de gnyis dang bzhi dang / drug la sogs pa mnyam pa'i ming gi yi ge yin na /
translated: If the name has an even number of syllables, such as two, four, six, and so on,

original: dang po dang mtha' ma bcug la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po dang mtha' ma bcug la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should insert the first and last syllables and offer it.

original: de nas sngon du spros pa'i khro bo la sogs pa rnams la bltas la //
analyzed: de nas sngon du spros pa'i khro bo la sogs pa rnams la bltas la //
translated: Then, one should look at the wrathful ones and so on that were previously emanated.

original: ji lta ba bzhin sngags kyi rkang pa rnams brjod la /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin sngags kyi rkang pa rnams brjod la /
translated: Recite the mantra limbs as they are.

original: aom a'a: h'um ho au shn'i sha sum bha ni sum bha bi ghan'am ta ka n'i la danda pra dzny'anta ka /takki r'a dz'a padm'a nta ka / aa tsa la ya m'anta ka /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um ho au shn'i sha sum bha ni sum bha bi ghan'am ta ka n'i la danda pra dzny'anta ka /takki r'a dz'a padm'a nta ka / aa tsa la ya m'anta ka /
translated: Om aḥ hūṃ hoḥ uṣṇīṣa śaṃ śubha ni śubha vighaṃ tākani laṃ daṃ prajñānta kaṃ takki rāja padmānta kaṃ aścala yaṃ anta kaṃ

original: ma h'a ba le bhya: sa pa ri w'a re bhya: ai dam ba lim gandham pushpam dh'u pam d'i pam a'a ksha tam /
analyzed: ma h'a ba le bhya: sa pa ri w'a re bhya: ai dam ba lim gandham pushpam dh'u pam d'i pam a'a ksha tam /
translated: mahābala bhyaḥ saparivāra bhyaḥ idaṃ baliṃ gandhaṃ puṣpaṃ dhūpaṃ dīpaṃ akṣataṃ

original: da d'a ma he /
analyzed: da d'a ma he /
translated: dadāmi mahā

original: te tsa a'a ga tya sa pa ri w'a re:/
analyzed: te tsa a'a ga tya sa pa ri w'a re:/
translated: te ca āgatya saparivāraḥ

original: sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihanan tu /
analyzed: sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim grihanan tu /
translated: śṛṇoti idaṃ baliṃ gṛhṇan tu

original: kh'a dantu: pi wantu dza: h'um bam ho: sam tri pt'a sarba stva nam sh'a ntim pu shtim raksha a'a ba ra na gu ptim ku rbntu h'um h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /
analyzed: kh'a dantu: pi wantu dza: h'um bam ho: sam tri pt'a sarba stva nam sh'a ntim pu shtim raksha a'a ba ra na gu ptim ku rbntu h'um h'um phat badzra dha ra a'a dzny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a /

analyzed: zhes pa ni khro bo'i rgyal bo rnams kyi gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: This is the bali mantra of the kings of wrathful ones.

analyzed: de ltar aom a'a: hum ho: a'a k'a sha b'a yu te rdzo da ka pri thi b'i s'a dhi te bhya: sa pa ri w'a re bhya: ai dam ba lim gandham / pushab / dh'u pam / d'i pam / aaksha tam da d'a ma he / te tsam a'a ga tya sa pa ri w'a r'a sh'i ghram ai dam ba lim gri hanntu / khang ntu pi wantu dza: h'um bam ho: sa tri pt'a / sarba stv'a nam sh'intam pushtam raksha a'a @117b wa ra na guptim kurbantu h'um h'um phat badzra dh'a ra a'a jny'a pa ya ti sv'a h'a / zhes pa ni nam mkha' la sogs bzad par rnams kyi gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: Thus, Om Ah Hum HOH, to the sky-clad one, the naked one, the one who has attained the state of the Prithivi, to you, together with your retinue, I offer this bali of perfume,🔽flowers, incense,🔽light, food, and drink,🔽and I give this great gift.🔽May the sky-clad one, together with his retinue, enjoy this bali,🔽eat it, drink it, and be satisfied.🔽May all beings be satisfied, nourished, and protected, and may they be guarded by the armor of invincibility.🔽Hum hum phat! The vajra-holder grants permission. Svâhâ!🔽 This is the mantra for the bali offering to the sky-clad ones and so forth.🔽
